thread.title: Netanyahu: Settlements are an issue but not the main issue
thread.title_full: Netanyahu: Settlements are an issue but not the main issue

author: JPOST.COM STAFF
title: Netanyahu: Settlements are an issue but not the main issue
text:
Netanyahu: Settlements are an issue but not the main issue By JPOST.COM STAFF February 17, 2017 05:10 Nonetheless, the prime minister says it is vital for Israel to "retain security control" in the West Bank. Efrat settlement, West Bank. (photo credit:MARC ISRAEL SELLEM/THE JERUSALEM POST) 
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Palestinian refusal to accept Israel, not settlements, is the main roadblock to peace. Speaking with MSNBC's Greta Van Susteren late on Thursday evening , he was asked why both US President Donald Trump and former US President Barack Obama have pegged Israeli settlements as a roadblock to Israeli-Palestinian peace. Netanyahu responded that he thinks settlements are "an issue, but I don't think it's the issue." Trump tells Netanyahu to 'hold back on settlements' during first meet The interview comes the day after his first meeting with Trump at the White House, where Trump asking Netanyahu to â€œhold back on settlements for a bit.""The real core of the conflict is not this or that settlement or this or that community," Netanyahu told Van Susteren, "but rather the persistent and enduring Palestinian refusal to recognize a Jewish state in any boundary." Trump tells Israel to 'hold back on settlements' during meeting with Netanyahu at White House on Feb. 15, 2017 (credit: REUTERS) He also said it was vital for Israel to "retain security control of the area west of the Jordan River," referring to the West BankTurning to the topic of peace in the region, Netanyahu said there was great potential for a broader peace between Israel and Arab countries in the Middle East, saying that Arab countries are beginning to view Israel as an ally for confronting Iran and Islamic State. "That has been bringing us closer together and may also pave avenues for peace."When asked to specifically name a country that has been softening its stance toward Israel he said "who's not?" to which Van Susteren responded that "Iran's not." Netanyahu responded back that Iran is not an Arab country. Relevant to your professional network? Please share on Linkedin Tags:
